intro: Pabstiella fluminensis, commonly known as the Brazilian spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, ribbed stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive shape, while its flowers are often inconspicuous, surrounded by colorful bracts. Pabstiella fluminensis is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
